Chapter 26.26:75: and Peter remembered what Jesus had told him: Before the rooster crows, you will say three times that you do not know me. He went out and wept bitterly.

Chapter 27.27:1: Early in the morning all the chief priests and the elders made their plans against Jesus to put him to death.

Chapter 27.27:2: They put him in chains, led him off, and handed him over to Pilate, the Roman governor.

Chapter 27.27:3: When Judas, the traitor, learned that Jesus had been condemned, he repented and took back the thirty silver coins to the chief priests and the elders.

Chapter 27.27:4: I have sinned by betraying an innocent man to death! he said. What do we care about that? they answered. That is your business!

Chapter 27.27:5: Judas threw the coins down in the Temple and left; then he went off and hanged himself.

Chapter 27.27:6: The chief priests picked up the coins and said, This is blood money, and it is against our Law to put it in the Temple treasury.

Chapter 27.27:7: After reaching an agreement about it, they used the money to buy Potter's Field, as a cemetery for foreigners.

Chapter 27.27:8: That is why that field is called Field of Blood to this very day.

Chapter 27.27:9: Then what the prophet Jeremiah had said came true: They took the thirty silver coins, the amount the people of Israel had agreed to pay for him,

Chapter 27.27:10: and used the money to buy the potter's field, as the Lord had commanded me.

Chapter 27.27:11: Jesus stood before the Roman governor, who questioned him. Are you the king of the Jews? he asked. So you say, answered Jesus.

Chapter 27.27:12: But he said nothing in response to the accusations of the chief priests and elders.

Chapter 27.27:13: So Pilate said to him, Don't you hear all these things they accuse you of?

Chapter 27.27:14: But Jesus refused to answer a single word, with the result that the Governor was greatly surprised.

Chapter 27.27:15: At every Passover Festival the Roman governor was in the habit of setting free any one prisoner the crowd asked for.

Chapter 27.27:16: At that time there was a well-known prisoner named Jesus Barabbas.

Chapter 27.27:17: So when the crowd gathered, Pilate asked them, Which one do you want me to set free for you? Jesus Barabbas or Jesus called the Messiah?

Chapter 27.27:18: He knew very well that the Jewish authorities had handed Jesus over to him because they were jealous.

Chapter 27.27:19: While Pilate was sitting in the judgment hall, his wife sent him a message: Have nothing to do with that innocent man, because in a dream last night I suffered much on account of him.

Chapter 27.27:20: The chief priests and the elders persuaded the crowd to ask Pilate to set Barabbas free and have Jesus put to death.

Chapter 27.27:21: But Pilate asked the crowd, Which one of these two do you want me to set free for you? Barabbas! they answered.

Chapter 27.27:22: What, then, shall I do with Jesus called the Messiah? Pilate asked them. Crucify him! they all answered.

Chapter 27.27:23: But Pilate asked, What crime has he committed? Then they started shouting at the top of their voices: Crucify him!

Chapter 27.27:24: When Pilate saw that it was no use to go on, but that a riot might break out, he took some water, washed his hands in front of the crowd, and said, I am not responsible for the death of this man! This is your doing!

Chapter 27.27:25: The whole crowd answered, Let the responsibility for his death fall on us and on our children!

Chapter 27.27:26: Then Pilate set Barabbas free for them; and after he had Jesus whipped, he handed him over to be crucified.

Chapter 27.27:27: Then Pilate's soldiers took Jesus into the governor's palace, and the whole company gathered around him.

Chapter 27.27:28: They stripped off his clothes and put a scarlet robe on him.

Chapter 27.27:29: Then they made a crown out of thorny branches and placed it on his head, and put a stick in his right hand; then they knelt before him and made fun of him. Long live the King of the Jews! they said.

Chapter 27.27:30: They spat on him, and took the stick and hit him over the head.

Chapter 27.27:31: When they had finished making fun of him, they took the robe off and put his own clothes back on him. Then they led him out to crucify him.

Chapter 27.27:32: As they were going out, they met a man from Cyrene named Simon, and the soldiers forced him to carry Jesus' cross.

Chapter 27.27:33: They came to a place called Golgotha, which means, The Place of the Skull.

Chapter 27.27:34: There they offered Jesus wine mixed with a bitter substance; but after tasting it, he would not drink it.

Chapter 27.27:35: They crucified him and then divided his clothes among them by throwing dice.

Chapter 27.27:36: After that they sat there and watched him.

Chapter 27.27:37: Above his head they put the written notice of the accusation against him: This is Jesus, the King of the Jews.

Chapter 27.27:38: Then they crucified two bandits with Jesus, one on his right and the other on his left.

Chapter 27.27:39: People passing by shook their heads and hurled insults at Jesus:

Chapter 27.27:40: You were going to tear down the Temple and build it back up in three days! Save yourself if you are God's Son! Come on down from the cross!

Chapter 27.27:41: In the same way the chief priests and the teachers of the Law and the elders made fun of him:

Chapter 27.27:42: He saved others, but he cannot save himself! Isn't he the king of Israel? If he will come down off the cross now, we will believe in him!

Chapter 27.27:43: He trusts in God and claims to be God's Son. Well, then, let us see if God wants to save him now!

Chapter 27.27:44: Even the bandits who had been crucified with him insulted him in the same way.

Chapter 27.27:45: At noon the whole country was covered with darkness, which lasted for three hours.

Chapter 27.27:46: At about three o'clock Jesus cried out with a loud shout,  Eli, Eli, lema sabachthani? which means, My God, my God, why did you abandon me?

Chapter 27.27:47: Some of the people standing there heard him and said, He is calling for Elijah!

Chapter 27.27:48: One of them ran up at once, took a sponge, soaked it in cheap wine, put it on the end of a stick, and tried to make him drink it.

Chapter 27.27:49: But the others said, Wait, let us see if Elijah is coming to save him!

Chapter 27.27:50: Jesus again gave a loud cry and breathed his last.

Chapter 27.27:51: Then the curtain hanging in the Temple was torn in two from top to bottom. The earth shook, the rocks split apart,

Chapter 27.27:52: the graves broke open, and many of God's people who had died were raised to life.

Chapter 27.27:53: They left the graves, and after Jesus rose from death, they went into the Holy City, where many people saw them.

Chapter 27.27:54: When the army officer and the soldiers with him who were watching Jesus saw the earthquake and everything else that happened, they were terrified and said, He really was the Son of God!

Chapter 27.27:55: There were many women there, looking on from a distance, who had followed Jesus from Galilee and helped him.

Chapter 27.27:56: Among them were Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of James and Joseph, and the wife of Zebedee.

Chapter 27.27:57: When it was evening, a rich man from Arimathea arrived; his name was Joseph, and he also was a disciple of Jesus.

Chapter 27.27:58: He went into the presence of Pilate and asked for the body of Jesus. Pilate gave orders for the body to be given to Joseph.

Chapter 27.27:59: So Joseph took it, wrapped it in a new linen sheet,

Chapter 27.27:60: and placed it in his own tomb, which he had just recently dug out of solid rock. Then he rolled a large stone across the entrance to the tomb and went away.

Chapter 27.27:61: Mary Magdalene and the other Mary were sitting there, facing the tomb.

Chapter 27.27:62: The next day, which was a Sabbath, the chief priests and the Pharisees met with Pilate

Chapter 27.27:63: and said, Sir, we remember that while that liar was still alive he said, I will be raised to life three days later.

Chapter 27.27:64: Give orders, then, for his tomb to be carefully guarded until the third day, so that his disciples will not be able to go and steal the body, and then tell the people that he was raised from death. This last lie would be even worse than the first one.

Chapter 27.27:65: Take a guard, Pilate told them; go and make the tomb as secure as you can.

Chapter 27.27:66: So they left and made the tomb secure by putting a seal on the stone and leaving the guard on watch.

Chapter 28.28:1: After the Sabbath, as Sunday morning was dawning, Mary Magdalene and the other Mary went to look at the tomb.

Chapter 28.28:2: Suddenly there was a violent earthquake; an angel of the Lord came down from heaven, rolled the stone away, and sat on it.

Chapter 28.28:3: His appearance was like lightning, and his clothes were white as snow.

Chapter 28.28:4: The guards were so afraid that they trembled and became like dead men.

Chapter 28.28:5: The angel spoke to the women. You must not be afraid, he said. I know you are looking for Jesus, who was crucified.

Chapter 28.28:6: He is not here; he has been raised, just as he said. Come here and see the place where he was lying.

Chapter 28.28:7: Go quickly now, and tell his disciples, He has been raised from death, and now he is going to Galilee ahead of you; there you will see him! Remember what I have told you.

Chapter 28.28:8: So they left the tomb in a hurry, afraid and yet filled with joy, and ran to tell his disciples.

Chapter 28.28:9: Suddenly Jesus met them and said, Peace be with you. They came up to him, took hold of his feet, and worshiped him.

Chapter 28.28:10: Do not be afraid, Jesus said to them. Go and tell my brothers to go to Galilee, and there they will see me.

Chapter 28.28:11: While the women went on their way, some of the soldiers guarding the tomb went back to the city and told the chief priests everything that had happened.

Chapter 28.28:12: The chief priests met with the elders and made their plan; they gave a large sum of money to the soldiers

Chapter 28.28:13: and said, You are to say that his disciples came during the night and stole his body while you were asleep.

Chapter 28.28:14: And if the Governor should hear of this, we will convince him that you are innocent, and you will have nothing to worry about.

Chapter 28.28:15: The guards took the money and did what they were told to do. And so that is the report spread around by the Jews to this very day.

Chapter 28.28:16: The eleven disciples went to the hill in Galilee where Jesus had told them to go.

Chapter 28.28:17: When they saw him, they worshiped him, even though some of them doubted.

Chapter 28.28:18: Jesus drew near and said to them, I have been given all authority in heaven and on earth.

Chapter 28.28:19: Go, then, to all peoples everywhere and make them my disciples: baptize them in the name of the Father, the Son, and the Holy Spirit,

Chapter 28.28:20: and teach them to obey everything I have commanded you. And I will be with you always, to the end of the age.
